title: How to become MCSD App Builder
content:
The globally recognized standard for developer excellence

The Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer (MCSD): App Builder certification validates that you have the skills needed to build modern mobile and/or web applications and services.

Earning an MCSD: App Builder certification qualifies you for a position as an application developer.

This MCSD certification can be earned as follows:

Step 1:

Earn either your Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) Web Applications certification or your MCSA: Universal Windows Platform certification.

Earning an MCSA: Web Applications certification qualifies you for a position as a web developer or web administrator.

Recommended Training Required Exam
Step 1 Programming in HTML5 with JavaScript and CSS3 (M20480) 70-480: Programming in HTML5 with JavaScript and CSS3*

*You can substitute Exam 70-483: Programming in C#
Step 2 Developing ASP.NET MVC 4 Web Applications (M20486) 70-486: Developing ASP.NET MVC Web Applications

Step 2:

Pass one of the following elective exams:

Recommended Training Exams (choose one)
Developing Microsoft Azure Solutions (M20532) 70-532: Developing Microsoft Azure Solutions
Developing Windows Azure and Web Services (M20487) 70-487: Developing Microsoft Azure and Web Services
Developing Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Core Solutions (M20488) 70-488: Developing Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Core Solutions
Developing Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Advanced Solutions (M20489) 70-489: Developing Microsoft SharePoint Server 2013 Advanced Solutions
Not yet available 70-354: Universal Windows Platform – App Architecture and UX/UI
Not yet available 70-355: Universal Windows Platform – App Data, Services, and Coding Patterns
MVA course: Administering Visual Studio TFS 2012 Jump Start 70-496: Administering Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server
Not yet available 70-497: Software Testing with Visual Studio
Not yet available 70-498: Delivering Continuous Value with Visual Studio Application Lifecycle Management
